intro: Aechmea brevicollis, commonly known as the short-necked pineapple plant, is a bromeliad native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The plant produces striking inflorescences with vibrant flowers that bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Aechmea brevicollis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
